alert.note: Alert for Green (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 7:57PM CST until March 05 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Wisconsin... Fox River Lower Near New Munster affecting Kenosha and Lake Counties. Pecatonica River At Martintown affecting Green County. .Residual effects of snow melt and recent rainfall will continue to contribute to river flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pecatonica River at Martintown. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Floodwaters affect Martintown Road and West River Road in the Martintown area. Upstream in Browntown, floodwaters affect highway MM and West Indies Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Friday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 13.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.7 feet on 03/05/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River forecasts are available for some but not all river gaging locations. The 7 day river forecast takes into account past precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and predicted precipitation for the basin. Precipitation is for the next 24 hours in the future from April through September and for 48 hours in the future from October through March. (Stages in ft.) Bank- Latest Forecast stages - Flood full observed ...for 6 pm... Location stage stage stage/time Sat Sun Mon Tue Martintown 13.5 9.5 13.34 7 pm 3/03 13.7 13.3 12.1 10.8 - Highest 24 hour change - observed in river stage - stage in (ft.) up to Highest stage - the last latest observed forecast in - 7 days stage next 7 days Martintown 13.34 7 pm 3/03 0.56 13.70 12 am 3/05 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued early Saturday morning.Saturday morning at 800 AM CST.
